fields.description: There is currently no option to disable a user from using the "start a team" option within the People dropdown of a JIra site. Admins and other permitted users should be able to configure a site to prevent this option from showing/accessing it.
fields.summary: Ability to prevent users from using the "start a team" option in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Quick Issue move might leave a ticket in an inconsistent state on the workflow

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JSM Next-Gen Project
# Create Request Type 'A'
# Create another Request Type 'B'
# Edit Request Type "B" configuration such as removing some statuses and save the configuration.
# Edit Request Type "B" again and re-add some of those statuses and add some new transitions to this status.
# Create a test ticket using Type 'A'
# Go to your mobile or web version and change the Request Type to 'B'

h3. Expected Results
Everything should be working just fine and you should see only the available transitions for that current status.

h3. Actual Results
You may notice some duplicated transitions or even some of them that were not supposed to be available in that specific status.

h3. Workaround
On the Web version, move the issue to another type and move back again
fields.summary: Quick Issue move might leave a ticket in an inconsistent state on the workflow

fields.description:
Sometimes user faces  500 Internal server error while using post-function to set/update the custom-field and leaving it empty.

It would be helpful to have a meaningful error message to understand the problem.
fields.summary: Meaningful error message instead of generic 500 Internal server error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The custom field created in Polski language throws 500 internal server error because of empty translation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Create a custom field in polski language that has an empty name translation (could be an empty string, has a space in it)
- Change the language settings to Polski, navigating to the *Advanced issue search* page will cause a 500 server error.

h3. Expected Results

It should ignore the empty translations for the custom fields that are not created in the English language 

h3. Actual Results

Navigating to the *Advanced issue search* page causes a 500 server error.

h3. Workaround

We can either provide a proper name translation for that field or remove the space in it.
fields.summary: Ignore empty translation for the custom field and use the original name instead

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Atlassian Switcher is broken in Jira.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click the top left button on the site
 # Check you can see the error saying *Something gone wrong*
 **  !Screen Shot 2020-12-16 at 11.41.34.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

Atlassian Switcher to be usable.
h3. Actual Results

The switcher is unavailable.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Atlassian Switcher is broken in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Over time, legacy filters, dashboards, boards, and other objects owned by users who are no longer in an organization begin to clutter up an instance. It becomes difficult to track down all of the objects that need to be reassigned, revised, or deleted. 
h3. Expected Results

Ideally, when a user is deactivated from an instance, Jira would serve up a list of associated artifacts that will remain on the instance once the user is deactivated. Viewing this information for existing users would also be beneficial.
fields.summary: Surface artifacts associated with users upon deactivation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Automation for Jira doesn't display condition based on Jira Service Management roles

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a rule 
# Add if
# Add the condition "User is a customer"

h3. Expected Results
The condition is listed on the rule

h3. Actual Results
The condition is not displayed until custom click on it
 !Screenshot 2020-12-15 at 16.50.35.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2020-12-15 at 16.50.44.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Automation for Jira doesn't display condition based on Jira Service Management roles

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Gadgets are facing a delay to synchronise the current data of issues with their results displayed in themselves.

During my tests, the problem was most noticeable with the issues' statuses.

Sometimes it takes more time to refresh, sometimes is not that noticeable.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a gadget with a filter (e.g. filter results);
** Add some columns, such as *Status* and *Priority*.
* Open one of the issues displayed under the results of the gadget, and update the issue;
** Change its priority, or transition the issue.
* Reload the dashboard.

h3. Expected Results

The gadgets will have its results updated right after you modified one of the issues that compose their results.

h3. Actual Results

There is a noticeable delay. See the recording:  [^Dashboard load delay.mp4] 

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Gadgets facing delay when loading the current data from issues
Improve Custom Fields management

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Configuring the Time Look and Feel to MM/dd/yyyy causes the time fields in advanced search to display 0020 instead of 2020

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the look and feel advanced settings and update the date picker format to MM/dd/yyyy
# Adjust the javascript format as well to read the %m%d%y

h3. Expected Results
The JQL advanced search should display the year as 2020

h3. Actual Results
When advanced searching issues and using a timestamp field, the resolver changes the year to 0020 instead of 2020

h3. Workaround
The JQL has problems to resolve the yyyy, changing to yy works but there are issues when importing issues using CSV.
fields.summary: Configuring the Time Look and Feel to MM/dd/yyyy causes the time fields in advanced search to display 0020 instead of 2020

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some users are unable to filter by Favorite Dashboards
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to all Dashboards screen
 # Select 2 or 3 Dashboards as favorites
 # Try to filter by Favorite and for some users, it works for others it does not

h3. Expected Results
Should work as expected for all users
h3. Actual Results
Some users are not able to filter by Favorite dashboards

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Some users are unable to filter by Favorite Dashboards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding the *Parent* field in a dashboard gadget and clicking on the column header to order by this field, the results won't change order unless the filter itself is set to order by parent.
This was tested with a filter that includes next-gen issues only.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a filter and order it by created
# Create a dashboard with a gadget that uses the filter from step 1
# Add the *Parent* field in the dashboard gadget
# Try to order the results by the *Parent* field

h3. Expected Results
Results should be ordered by any of the available columns by clicking on the headers

h3. Actual Results
Clicking on the *Parent* header makes no difference unless the JQL filter itself is ordered by this field

h3. Workaround

Add *ORDER BY parent* in the JQL filter
fields.summary: Adding the "Parent" field as a column on a dashboard doesn't allow to order results by it

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There is "Project links" feature in Jira Cloud <=> Bitbucket Server/DC, but some features are work well as Jira Server/DC <=> Bitbucket Server/DC.

Jira Cloud: [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/configure-projects/]

For example, when creating branch from Jira Cloud issue, the feature of the prioritized repository in Project links does not work well,
 !bitbucket-server-create-branch-screen.png|thumbnail!

~> there is no project key parameter in URL( `/plugins/servlet/create-branch?issuKey=SAM-3&issuType=Task&issueSummary=sample3+task` ).

in spite of the following project links configuration.
 !jira-cloud-project-link-between-bitbucket-server.png|thumbnail!

!jira-cloud-application-link-configuration.png|thumbnail!
h4. in case of server's project link

In Jira Server <=> Bitbucket Server/DC, project priority feature in "Project links" works like this.
 !bitbucket-server-create-branch-screen-with-jira-server.png|thumbnail!

~> there is project key parameter in URL ( `/plugins/servlet/create-branch?issueKey=SAM-10&issueType=Story&issueSummary=As+a+developer%2C+I+can+update+story+and+task+status+with+drag+and+drop+%28click+the+triangle+at+far+left+of+this+story+to+show+sub-tasks%29&projectKey=SAM3` )
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide project priority feature in "Project links" between Jira Cloud and Bitbucket Server/DC( like "in case of server's project link" section).
 - create branch
 -- [Bitbucket Server/DC document: Configuring Project links across Applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/configuring-project-links-across-applications-976171951.html]
 -- > When you create a feature branch from Jira, repositories from a linked Jira project will be prioritized in the list of repositories.

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround, you should specify the project on the screen.
fields.summary: Provide project priority feature in "Project links" between Jira Cloud and Bitbucket Server/DC

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to have the same options as the Label system field while bulk editing a custom label field.
Currently, there are options to find and replace, remove all, keep existing and other options while editing the Jira Label system field.
However, these options are not available while editing a Custom Label field, the only option is to add more labels and it does not work very well while bulking updating issues.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to have the same options as the Label system field while bulk editing a custom label field

fields.description:
*Summary*

The old issue view has a feature to expand and collapse a single comment. However, the same feature is missing in the New issue view.

In case of lengthy comments, to navigate through the comments it is helpful to collapse the body of each comment individually but still see when the comment was created and by who.

!Comment.png|thumbnail!

[^Screen Recording 2020-12-14 at 2.31.20 PM.mov]
fields.summary: Ability to collapse the single comments in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When transitioning an issue customers getting the following error:
"Error type: 500 - Internal server error" 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Attempt to transition an issue

h3. Expected Results
issue is transitions with no errors

h3. Actual Results
Error type 500 is displayed

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Error type: 500 - Internal server error being thrown for Jira - on workflow transition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Service Management (JSM) sends the statuscategory as "Complete" in the outgoing payload when  closing or resolving tickets.

Even though the statuscategory is configured as "Done" for the status "Close" or "Resolve", the statuscategory is getting sent as "Complete".

The legacy automation sends the correct statuscategories in the payload. The system webhooks send the incorrect payload.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Status called "Resolved" and assign it to statuscategory "Done".
 # Create a ticket and mark the status of the ticket to "Resolved"
 # Check the outgoing payload sent from JSM. The statuscategory has the value "Complete"

h3. Expected Results

The statuscategory should be having the value "Done". Payload from a legacy automation showing the correct values are shown below.
{code:json}
#### Payload from Legacy Automation showing the correct values #### "statusCategory": { "self": "https://uravi-stg-test.jira-dev.com/rest/api/2/statuscategory/3", "id": 3, "key": "done", "colorName": "green", "name": "Done" }
{code}
h3. Actual Results

The statuscategory has the value "Complete". This value is no where configured in the JSM setup. Sample payload shown below.
{noformat}
				
#### payload from system webhooks showing incorrect statuscategory ####
"statusCategory": {
					"self": "https://uravi-stg-test.jira-dev.com/rest/api/2/statuscategory/3",
					"id": 3,
					"key": "done",
					"colorName": "green",
					"name": "Complete"
				}
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Use the webhooks method provided via Legacy Automation under Project Settings > Automation. Payload sent via Legacy Automation puts the correct statuscategory.
fields.summary: Jira sending incorrect statuscategory in payload when closing tickets

fields.description:
*Suggestion*

As of now, Jira allows JQL to search using the Option ID only for the Select List (Cascading) custom field type.

A similar ability should be provided for Select List (single choice) and Select List (multi-choice).
 !Custom Field.png|thumbnail!
|Option ID| !URL-1.png|thumbnail!|
|JQL not able to search using the ID|!JQL Error.png|thumbnail!!|
fields.summary: Ability to search using the custom field options ID for Single and Multi choice custom field in JQL

fields.description:
*Summary* 

Email notifications event list the  _Issue Comment Deleted_ as and configurable event in the notification scheme. However, the notifications for this event are to Issue Updated. 

Also, the [public document mentions|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/configure-notification-schemes/] that this event does not exist.

The event should be removed as an available option in the notification scheme.


|Available feature||!Notificatione event.png|thumbnail!| 
|Notification helper||!Notification Scheme.png|thumbnail!|
fields.summary: Issue comment deleted notifications event is a misleading configuration in the notification scheme

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

App developers see a large number of warnings in the browser which makes debugging difficult. The most prevalent of these is:

DevTools failed to load SourceMap: Could not load content for [https://statlas.prod.atl-paas.net/jira-frontend-source-]...

See [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/jira-cloud-statlas-prod-atl-paas-net-and-source-map-files/43680] for further context.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Disconnect from Atlassian's network if connected.
 # Open DevTools.
 # Switch tot he Console tab.
 # Load a Jira issue page.
 # Observe the contents of the Console tab.

h3. Expected Results

The Console tab is fairly clear.
h3. Actual Results

The console tab has a vast number of messages such as DevTools failed to load SourceMap: Could not load content for [https://statlas.prod.atl-paas.net/jira-frontend-source-]...
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Large number of SourceMap load failure warnings makes debugging difficult

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Story Point field is editable in the new issue view although the field does not exist in the edit issue view. This only happens in the new issue view and works fine in the old issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a new screen for Edit issue view  
 * Remove Story point field from the screen
 * Edit the issue the Story point field is editable in the new issue view 

h3. Expected Results

The Story point should not be editable in the New Issue View
h3. Actual Results

The Story point is editable in the New Issue View
h3. Workaround

Use Old Issue View
fields.summary: Read only Story Point are editable in the new view but not the old view

fields.description:
In cases where Development Commits and Pull Requests can appear on both a Parent story, and any number of subtasks, it would be ideal to have a single location to view all related Commits & Pull Requests.

Some teams have preferences of which item to link their development Commits or PRs to, but there's no single way of easily getting an overview of everything.
fields.summary: Show all Development Commits & Pullrequests in the parent JIRA ticket

fields.description:
h3. *Problem:*

Currently, the editor to add a default value to the Description has fewer options than the editor when we are editing an issue.

!Screen Shot 2020-06-17 at 16.52.49.png|width=287,height=211!
h3. *Suggestion:*

Add the same editor for both View/Edit and the Description field on the Issue type, so administrators can add a table and other information as the default value for the field.

!Screen Shot 2020-06-17 at 16.53.15.png|width=384,height=177!
fields.summary: Add the same Description editor from the View/Edit screen to Issue type

fields.description:
In the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget, it is currently not possible to select "group" under statistics and this prevents us from creating a group vs status mapping.

If a user wants to know which group has how many issues per status, we do not have any gadget for such mapping.
fields.summary: Make "Group" option available to categorise data in two-dimensional gadget

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With the deprecation of legacy automation we are missing the 'when linked issue transitions trigger' 
This leads the rule to run more time than needed, and with new automation there are rule usage limits so it would be good to have the trigger that we had in legacy to at least reduce the rule executions. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to trigger "When linked issue transition"
fields.summary: Add the ability to trigger "When linked issue transition"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When navigating between issues from within filter's results, either by using the arrow button to switch between issues, or the *Return to search* button in the top right, the attachments displayed within each issue might take a while to be refreshed.

See the recording:  [^test.mp4] 

On more aggravated cases, the attachment's section might run into a glitch where it will constantly reload, displaying attachments from previous issues you have accessed before.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Access a filter;
* Put the view in list mode:
 !Screen Shot 2020-12-10 at 09.48.15.png|thumbnail! 
* Start navigating trough the issues;
** Access an issue;
** Use the *Return to search* in the top right to return to the filter results and select another issue;
** If you keep repeating the same process quicker (without even waiting for the attachments full load on an issue), it might be easier to replicate the problem, and even run into that glitch.

h3. Expected Results

The attachments' load should follow the rest of the view, and not present any kind of delay.

h3. Actual Results

There is a delay in the attachments section, which makes the view show attachments from the previous accessed issue.

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Switching issue on filters issue Page takes a while to replace Attachments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Automation fails when has two fields with the same name/type, showing the error "*Found multiple fields with the same name and type:*"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new *number* custom field in a Next-Gen project
 # Create a rule to copy the value from this field. Below, follows an example.
 !image-2020-12-10-09-36-27-134.png|thumbnail! 
 # Set the rule scope for the Next-Gen project.
 # Under <instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewCustomFields.jspa create a new *number* custom field with the same name.
 # Associated the "*number*" custom field to a classic project.
 !image-2020-12-10-09-36-39-080.png|thumbnail! 

 * Reload the rule, and then run the rule.
 * Then will appear the error "*Found multiple fields with the same name and type:*"

h3. Expected Results

When we set the scope of the rule to a Next-Gen project, it should not consider a classic custom field. 
h3. Actual Results

Even the rule restricts to the Next-Gen project, appear the error "*Found multiple fields with the same name and type:*". The rule is considering a field with the same name and type, causing this error. 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

We can change the field name to a different one, and then the rule will run without error.
    !image-2020-12-10-09-36-57-304.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Automation fails when has two fields with the same name/type, showing the error "Found multiple fields with the same name and type:"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating or updating an issue via Jira Rest API v3 and the workflow has a post function to clear a custom field the API will fail with an error:
 We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file."],"errors":{}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a Custom Field to the project
 # Add a post function to clear the Field value of that custom field
 # Try to use the Jira REST API v3 create API

h3. Expected Results

The issue should be Created.
h3. Actual Results

Issue Creation Fails:
{noformat}
We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file."],"errors":{}
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 # Use API v2 if you are using post functions to clear values of a custom field on a workflow transition.
fields.summary: Post function to clear a custom field will fail issue update/creation via API V3

fields.description:
*Issue* - While selecting a value for a custom field of Radio button type, the options at times are not showing up properly and the panel of values that shows up looks trimmed.

We are suspecting that this happens in Windows only since it was not reproducible in Mac.

*Expected behavior* -

All options should show up

*Actual behavior* - 

Options are trimmed as shown in the screenshot

*Workaround* - At times changing the browser might help.
fields.summary: Radio button custom field - All options are not showing up on the screen and gets trimmed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

"Your Work" Tab in Jira does not show the tickets as per the timeline
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to "*Your Work*" tab on your Jira site. For Example, you can find *NCP-4* showing created under "*More than a Month ago*".
{quote}!Screenshot 2020-12-10 at 12.30.24 PM.png|thumbnail!
{quote}
 # If we go to the actual ticket *NCP-4*, you can see that the ticket was created on November 20th. (_Screenshot taken on 10th December_).
{quote}!Screenshot 2020-12-10 at 12.31.59 PM-1.png|thumbnail!
{quote}

h3. Expected Results

It was Supposed to show the tickets in "*the Last month*" category but it shows under "*More than a month ago*". 
h3. Actual Results

It shows the tickets under "*More than a Month ago*" which is confusing for the user.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Your Work" Tab in Jira does not show the tickets as per the timeline

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The creation of NextGen projects results in certain types of issue types being created and scoped to the project. However, the deletion of issue types does not result in the issue types scoped to the project from being deleted.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Query the issue types: [https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issuetype]
 # Create a NextGen project.
 # Query the issue types: [https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issuetype]
 # Move the project to trash.
 # Query the issue types: [https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issuetype]

h3. Expected Results

At step 5, the returned issue types are the same as those from step 1.
h3. Actual Results

At step 5, the returned issue types are the same as those from step 3, except without the scoping to the deleted project thus causing them to be indistinguishable from certain other non project scoped issue types.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Project scoped issue types become orphaned on project deletion

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Component/s field with empty value that is being Bulk Moved from one Issue type to another on the same Project and the component/s field is *Required* in the *field configuration* throws an error. The error that is thrown on the Bulk move is due to the Required field configuration, however there's no input field that is visible for a value to be entered. It is greyed out.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Go to your Field Configurations, create two different Field Configurations for each IssueType. example *Task* and *Bug*
 - Add that Field Configuration to your Field configuration Scheme, then associate that field configuration scheme to your Project per issue type.
- Make the component/s field Required under issue type *Bug*
- Create a Task without component field 
- Search for*Task * issues using the Issue Navigator. Example JQL below
{code}project = TES and issuetype = "Task" order by created DESC{code}

h3. Expected Results
Since the Component/s field is required, an input field should be visible, so a user can key in a value during the move

h3. Actual Results
The Component/s field is required without any Input field. checking on the Dev console shows the input field is hidden after being disabled

Error during bulk move:
You can see that "Components" is not editable and greyed out. In my example, "Call Type" field is also a Required field but the system allows to add a value:
 !image-2020-12-10-13-03-40-052.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Make the Component/s field optional from the *Field Configuration* for both Issuetypes.
fields.summary: Empty Component field returns "Field is required error" during Bulk Move

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Progress field on JQL filter does not show correct information

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a *Next-gen* project
 # create a story/task
# create two child issues

h3. Expected Results
On issue view under the Story/Task, progess bar should reflect the progress of child issues
On Advanced issue filter, when adding "Progress" to the columns, it should also reflect the progress on the parent issue

h3. Actual Results
On issue view under the Story/Task, *Progress* bar should reflect the progress of child issues - This is reflecting correctly
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
On Advanced issue filter, when adding "Progress" to the columns, it should also reflect the progress on the parent issue - This is not reflecting correctly
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

Note, this is working correctly under *Classic* projects

h3. Workaround
Currently, you can see the progress directly on the issue view of the parent issue
fields.summary: For Next-gen projects, Progress bar is not reflecting under Advanced issue filter

fields.description:
There was an option to process JQL results from a Scheduled automation trigger as bulk to perform a single action in them. This is shown in the attached screenshot.

Users could benefit from this issue to be available again as sometimes they don't need the result list to be treated as a whole instead of performing actions in each issue.

Although the Lookup Issues action was introduced it is limited in the amount of fields that can be retrieved and also will cause the automation rule to fail if the lookup returns no issues.
fields.summary: Add the "Process all issues as bulk" option for the JQL search in the Scheduled automation trigger

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an email message is pulled by Jira, all of the HTML content will be stripped out and converted to wiki format, to then be converted to the new Atlassian Document Format (ADF). However, if part of the content comes with {color:default} value, this fails to be converted to ADF.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
If you send an email using some apps(like AirMail) and if part of the content comes with {color:default} value, the ticket will not be created.

h3. Expected Results
The expected behavior is for the email to be processed and the ticket to be created.

h3. Actual Results
The email fails and we can see the following information when looking at the mail logs: "Your request could not be created. Please check the fields have been correctly filled in."

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Email fails if part of the content comes with {color:default} value

fields.description:
It'd be great if you could change the relationship of linked issues with a single click (similar to the ability to do this for issue type) instead of having to unlink and relink the linked issue with a new relationship.

Linked issues (requires removing & re-adding to change relationship):

!Screen Shot 2020-12-09 at 12.28.23 PM.png|width=525,height=214!

 

One/several-click functionality to change an issue type upon hovering: 

!Screen Shot 2020-12-09 at 12.29.20 PM.png!
fields.summary: Change linked issue relationship without needing to unlink & relink

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When customers follow the process to reset [JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/reset-and-delete-all-data-from-your-cloud-site-691012037.html] by deactivating and re-activating its subscription the global permissions are not restored correctly.

This causes issues as the customer won't be able to search for users and groups within the application.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure you have Confluence and JIRA at your instance.
 # Follow the reset process outlined [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/reset-and-delete-all-data-from-your-cloud-site-691012037.html].

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should be added to the instance as a new installation with the default global permissions.

 !image-2020-12-09-12-28-12-001.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

JIRA is added with missing global permissions:
 !image-2020-12-09-12-27-08-774.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Add the permissions manually after granting the *Browse users and groups* to anyone.
fields.summary: Resetting JIRA doens't re-create its global permissions correctly

fields.description:
At this moment Teams can't be used to manage user permissions, but if we creating teams, we should be able to manage those teams permissions directly. 

Specially since we are unable to link a group to a team to make them interchangable. 

As an admin I want to be able to use TEAMS to give project roles to my users.
fields.summary: As an admin I want to use TEAMS for project roles (like you can with groups)

fields.description:
In our organization, we use to copy the link of the attachment and paste it in the comments section for better visibility of the attachment.

Since Old issue view is going to be deprecated we started using New issue view, and we do not see any *Copy Link Address* option, unlike Old issue view.

- Right-click on the attachment (Old Issue view)
 !image-2020-12-09-16-33-47-008.png|thumbnail! 

- Right-click on the attachment (NewIssue view)
 !image-2020-12-09-16-35-47-979.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Copy Link Address on the New issue view attachments missing

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
When Jira receives an email to be processed by email request, there's no method for Jira to pull the "To" and "CC" data to be used as issue details. Since these data exist in the email header, we should have the ability to pull those.

h3. Suggested solution
Add ability for smart values to obtain "To" and "CC" from emails.
fields.summary: Add ability for smart values to obtain "To" and "CC" from emails

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When updating a date picker field using {{{{now}}}} 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure an Automation rule with an Edit issue fields action to update a date picker field (custom field or Jira default) setting the value as {{{{now}}}}
 # Check the history of the issue that was just updated.
 # The value is correctly updated, but the history shows -1d value

h3. Expected Results

The history should show the same value that was set on the issue and that is shown on https://<your_jira_instance>/rest/api/2/issue/<issue_KEY>?expand=changelog
{code:java}
},
          "displayName": "Automation for Jira",
          "active": true,
          "timeZone": "America/Toronto",
          "accountType": "app"
        },
        "created": "2020-12-08T09:12:02.037-0500",
        "items": [
          {
            "field": "Date de transfert",
            "fieldtype": "custom",
            "fieldId": "customfield_10137",
            "from": null,
            "fromString": null,
            "to": "2020-12-08",
            "toString": "8/Dec/20"
          }{code}
h3. Actual Results

The value is correctly set, but the issue's history shows a -1d value:

!image-2020-12-08-18-59-28-984.png|width=722,height=306!
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround for this.
fields.summary: Issue history shows the wrong date (-1d) when a date picker field is updated by an Automation rule using {{now}}
Allow nested markdown on new Atlassian Rich Text Editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In *Checkbox, Dropdown* custom field types, the options added with lengthy names don't display the complete name in the issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a *Check box* custom field and add an option with a lengthy name
# Associate the above created custom field with a project
# Open an issue in the project and in the check box field, only a part of the lengthy name is shown in the issue view

h3. Expected Results
The complete name should be displayed in the issue view 

h3. Actual Results
Only a part of the checkbox option is displayed

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Display the complete name of the field options in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

When an attachment is copy-pasted from one comment to another and the former comment is deleted, the attachment in the second comment is also removed.

h3. Steps to replicate

# Create a comment with an attachment in a Jira issue(Software, JSM, or Core).
# Edit the first comment and copy-paste the attachment to the second comment. Save the second comment.
# Delete the first comment which is currently in the edit state.
# Refresh the page. The second comment does not display the attachment.

h3. Suggested solution

Retain the attachments in the issue despite the original comment adding the attachment was deleted.
fields.summary: Retain attachments in issue despite the original comment adding the attachment was deleted

fields.description: Confluence keeps a history of the changes and it allows you to revert (https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/page-history-and-page-comparison-views-139379.html). It would be helpful to have this option for Jira issues (not just being able to check changes in the History section).
fields.summary: Revert to earlier/previous version

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The fields menu in company-managed (formerly classic) projects (plugins/servlet/project-config/\{projectid}/fields) displays all fields in the Default Field Configuration including team-managed (formerly next-gen) fields. This can cause inconsistencies in the display of fields on the various screens and may cause confusion to the users.



This is happening for Jira Core, Software, and JSM projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field in a team-managed (formerly next-gen) project.
 #  Navigate to a company-managed (formerly classic) project which uses the default field configuration
 # Navigate to project settings → fields
 # Inspect the list of fields in the default field configuration. The team-managed (formerly next-gen) field will be listed over here.

h3. Expected Results

The team-managed (formerly next-gen) fields should not show up under the Fields configuration of company-managed (formerly classic) projects.
h3. Actual Results

The team-managed (formerly next-gen) fields show up under the Fields configuration of company-managed (formerly classic) projects which is using Default Field Configuration.
h3. Workaround

NA
fields.summary: The fields menu in company-managed (formerly classic) projects project settings displays team-managed (formerly next-gen) fields in the Default Field Configuration.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a ticket that uses a 'Field has been modified Validator' on the description field, Jira does not display the error message specified in the validator settings when using the inline issue creation inside of an Epic.

This behaviour is also reproducible on the 'Field Required Validator'.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new validator on a workflow step using the FIeld has been modified Validator
 # Make sure you have specified an error message
 # Attempt to create a new ticket issue inside of an Epic, using the plus sign "+" next to *Issues in this epic*

h3. Expected Results

Jira should display the error that you provided in the validator settings
h3. Actual Results

Jira shows the following message when creating issues inside an epic:
{quote}We couldn't create the child issue
 Check your connection, then give it another try
{quote}
!Screen Shot 2020-12-07 at 4.55.29 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
 # Create new issues using the "Create" button in the top navigation bar and add this to the epic later, or
 # Remove the field required validator
fields.summary: Jira displays generic error message instead of error specified in workflow validator settings

fields.description:
Disable the Jira issue creation notification whenever a ticket is raised for a single user. For example:
* The user "xxx" creates an issue in the Jira project, nobody gets notified. If any other create an issue, send notification according to the notification scheme.
fields.summary: Not fire notification when specific user create an issue
Allow webhook event type in the URL variable substitutions

fields.description:
Slack stopped receiving notifications from Jira having about 15 subscriptions for a single project, many of those with JQL. 

 

*Workaround* - 


 # Decrease the number of subscriptions to that project, especially those that have JQL in their configurations. 

 # Subscriptions that target specific users can all be replaced with Personal Notifications. Remove those subscriptions and ask users to type /jira notify in Slack. They will get notifications when they are assigned, mentioned, etc. It’s more precise and lightweight.
fields.summary: Make slack-jira integration more efficient as having multiple subscriptions with JQL lead to rate limit

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Customer has updated the worklog using REST API, however, they are not able to delete or edit this worklog in the UI as they are seeing this entry being made only under 'history" tab. On checking the "worklog" tab, the specific worklog is not seen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use the REST API to generate worklog for an issue
 # Navigate to worklog tab and check for this entry to edit or delete.
*Note*: Issue is replicable only in customer instance.

h3. Expected Results
- User must be able to edit and delete this worklog that is being made by REST API

h3. Actual Results
- Only under the history tab, we are seeing this worklog entry that is being made by the user.
- On navigating to "worklog" tab, there is no entry seen for this worklog.

h3. Workaround
The solution at the moment is to use the REST API call itself to update or delete this specific worklog as they are not seen in the UI.
GET URL: https://host.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/KEY-3262/worklog/1313
DELETE URL: https://host.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/KEY-2/worklog/1313
fields.summary: Jira Worklog created by API, is seen in history and not under "worklog" tab - intermittent issue

fields.description:
When logging hours using new issue view, Jira only allows us to use, for example, 04:15 pm if I want to log hours for 04:15PM. This does not accept 4:15pm not even 04:15 PM.

However, the time that is suggested are at 06:30 PM format:

!image-2020-12-04-20-36-11-486.png|width=230,height=324!

[https://share.getcloudapp.com/nOuDWXjE]
fields.summary: Date Started on Log Work only accepts a specific format that is different from the one suggested

fields.description:
h3. Description
Using the new issue view if we add a link to an external(public) image the image is not rendered as used to be on the old issue view. 

In the old issue view, we used to have the ability to render a file without adding it as an attachment by using the following syntax.
{noformat}
!URL_LINK!
{noformat}

ps. Either the description or comments section is not rendering a preview of the link.

h3. Use case
That makes it easier to share public images with other users that are not supposed to be necessarily an attachment. Besides that, it improves the user experience for the notifications.

h3. Workaround
Add file as an attachment
fields.summary: Add the ability to render public image links on the new issue view

fields.description:
Greetings,


When using advanced search in Jira Cloud, JQL query always added field type information after custom field's name automaticaly. I would like to request add feature to toggle on/off this information in configuration to avoid confuse users.

 

As a Jira admin or advanced user, it's friendly when searching and identifying fields with similar names but have different field type in JQL advanced search; however, not everyone can adapt to search a custom field that having field type information, especially for users migrating from server/data center to cloud but don't want to re-write the entire saved search filters, having feature to toggle on/off field type in JQL search will improve the user experience with Jira cloud.

 

Best regards,
fields.summary: Ability to toggle on/off display filed type in advanced search

fields.description:
h1. Existing feature to start off with

As described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/reset-and-delete-all-data-from-your-cloud-site-691012037.html], a system administrator can can *reset* an Atlassian product on a cloud instance *manually*.
h1. New feature proposal
h2. Basic expectation

However, I would appreciate if there was the possibility to do such steps - *reset/delete, reactivate host products - programmatically, i.e. via REST API calls*.
h2. Additional expectations

Eventually, I'd also welcome a new feature to even *create and permanently delete cloud instances* on behalf of another "master" instance (or its administrator).

As far as I know, permanently deleting an instance is currently possible by contacting the support team and personally submitting a dedicated request only.
The first step would be to allow for initiating this action on the System Administration / Apps Management UI. This would give *full control over instance management* for the system admin.
As a second step, these actions should be made available programmatically, too. In other words, custom Atlassian cloud sites (e.g. Jira or Confluence instances) should be dynamically created, configured ("factory reset", populated with initial data, etc.), operated and killed upon changing needs.

Instances cannot and should not be managed by another, random account, but permission should be granted for "friend" accounts. This is what I meant with the master-slave analogy. Technically speaking, a master account (cloud instance owner) should be able to create new, temporary test instances on *subdomains*, without interfering the global Atlassian ecosystem.
As the resources are finite, of course, I would understand if there were some limits defined for each account, how many of such test/temporary environments could be in use in parallel (they could use a sort of _cloud instance pool_). On the other hand, if the life-cycle management of such test instances would be kept under control of the system admin (or some custom-developed app, which does this management in place of the admin), this would be a powerful feature, anyway.
h1. Background, rationale

Just to provide some reasoning to my request, in order to effectively configure and use/reuse cloud environments for testing purposes upon emerging needs (e.g. to test an addon built from a spcific branch), cloud instances and installed host products should be managed programmatically.
For the time being, the only possibility is to request a private developer/test instance, configure it manually and deploy/debug/test your apps on there. I would be grateful, if all this fiddling could be replaced some company-wide, transparent, for everyone accessible (I mean, shareable with all team members) mechanism.
fields.summary: Ability to reset host products (and delete all their data) on cloud instances programmatically

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding a comment or editing the description of an issue using the new issue view, the *Save* and *Cancel* buttons are always displayed in English. The personal language settings of the account and the default language of the site do not change the language on these buttons.

 !save_cancel_buttons.png|thumbnail! 

This same is happening in Jira Core, Jira Software, and Jira Service Management projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change your profile language to a language other than English.
 # Edit the description of an issue

h3. Expected Results
The text on the Save and Cancel buttons is translated.

h3. Actual Results
The text is always shown as *Save* and *Cancel*

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The Save and Cancel buttons in the new issue view are not translated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Favicon doesn't work on Safari browser.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Created a Favicon from <Atlassian URL>/secure/admin/LookAndFeel!default.jspa
 # Access the site from Safari browser and the favicon doesn't appear. 

h3. Expected Results

favicon should appear. 

h3. Actual Results

Favicon is missing.

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Favicon doesn't work on Safari browsers.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When opening the smart commit information from the development panel in a new tab, it loads the issue on the old issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure to have an issue with smart commits
# Right click at the smart commit and select to open in a new tab

See the video reproducing the issue: https://share.getcloudapp.com/xQuApr6Z

h3. Expected Results
The new issue view must be kept while opening the development panel information in a new tab

h3. Actual Results
It opens a new tab with the old issue view

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When opening the commit information from the development panel in a new tab, it loads the issue on the old issue view

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a way to delete Jira tickets. My and my coworkers have noticed that we often create issues in project planning that get descoped or duplicated during the implementation phase.

*It would be helpful to have a way to delete unwanted tickets to avoid clogging the system.* Currently we need to mark them as "done" instead which isn't an accurate reflection of its status.
fields.summary: Add a way to delete Jira tickets

fields.description:
Some projects will have multiple issue types and all of them will be displayed when using the Slack integration to create issues from Slack.

e.g.: The channel's purpose is to raise service requests or incidents, but change requests, or access requests, along with others that are not relevant are also being displayed.
fields.summary: Allow customization of the Jira create issue form within Slack

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The vendor reported that webhook without `user` field breaks app functionality, because they are not able to parse webhook without `user` field.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open your Jira instance
 # Go to `external system import` section
 # Import some issues from CSV

h3. Expected Results

`jira:issue_created` webhooks are sent with `user` field.

`jira:issue_updated` webhooks are sent with `user` field.
h3. Actual Results

`jira:issue_created` webhooks are sent with `user` field.
`jira:issue_uptaded` webhooks are sent WITHOUT `user` field. (This webhooks inform about changed issue rank)
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When the issue import operation is performed `issue_updated` webhooks are sent without `user` field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Field value changes on Edit Issue actions are not triggering in the new issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure your rule to track changes done to an issue on Edit issue operation.
 # Edit your issue's field value. 
 # The rule does *not* get triggered
 ## Additionally, leaving the operation field as empty, *would* trigger the rule however even when you are editing the issue.
 # Screen recording here: [^Screen Recording 2020-12-04 at 1.27.41 PM.mov]

h3. Expected Results

The rule would execute when editing the issue field.
h3. Actual Results

The rule does not get triggered.
h3. Workaround

Turn off the new issue view, i.e., the Jira Labs feature from Profile > Personal Settings, and then the rule would trigger as expected.
fields.summary: Field value changes on Edit Issue actions are not triggering

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, you can link Confluence pages in the issue view by using the link button:
 !Screen Shot 2020-12-03 at 10.52.16.png|thumbnail! 

But, the text displayed inside the field is misleading, as it does not match with the expected behaviour of the feature:
 !Screen Shot 2020-12-03 at 10.50.58.png|thumbnail! 

The text states *"Search pages..."*. 

Actually, you can't search for pages. 

You can either paste the link to one, or select the recently accessed pages from the dropdown. Even if you type the name of a page that you have not accessed recently, it on't be retrieved.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Click on the link button dropdown -> *Link Confluence page*.

h3. Expected Results

The field will state that you can select recently accessed pages, or paste the link to a specific one.

h3. Actual Results

The text states that you can search for pages, giving the idea that users can search for any page by just typing in their name.

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Misleading text in Confluence page link

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:

Currently, we observe some latency when a select list custom field loads values from a large data set of above 2k values.

Jira native custom fields of type select-list having more than 2000 items will decrease in performance.
h3. Suggested Solution:

Improve the performance with the [API endpoints|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-custom-field-options/#api-group-issue-custom-field-options] to work with larger data sets
fields.summary: Improve the performance with select list custom fields with large data sets

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In Jira personal settings there is a "Watch your issues" option to automatically add the user as a watcher of every issue he is interacting with. You can Enable/Disable this option. However, a user may require this option to be enabled for specific projects only.  This is not currently available.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option to mention provide the project name in the "Watch your issues"  option in personal settings. This will help the user to become an auto watcher for specific projects only.
h3. Workaround

NA
fields.summary: Ability to configure project name in 'Watch your issues' option in personal settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Cloud allows remote, unauthenticated attackers to view custom field names and custom SLA names via an Information Disclosure vulnerability in the /secure/QueryComponent!Default.jspa endpoint.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the Jira Cloud URL: https://hostname.atlassian.net/secure/QueryComponent!Default.jspa as anonymous user without logging in.

h3. Expected Results
The endpoint should not expose custom field names etc.

h3. Actual Results
It shows custom field names and custom SLA names.

h3. Update

We have tested this issue in Jira Cloud and have found that the issue described in the ticket is not reproducible. If an unauthorised user tries to access the URL, the user can see default Jira fields - that are the same for any instance, not custom fields. Thus no sensitive information gets exposed & we have closed this ticket.
fields.summary: Sensitive data exposure via /secure/QueryComponent!Default.jspa endpoint - CVE-2020-14179

fields.description:
On Old Issue View, if we click on *Create a sub-task*, a popup screen is shown and we have the ability to set more than just the summary for the sub-tasks. 

While in the New Issue View, we can only set the Summary for each sub-task and then have to click on each one of them and apply the other necessary fields.

It would be great to have that feature added to the New Issue View, besides the option we already have.

h4. New Issue View Create subtask button:
 !image-2020-12-02-23-22-21-495.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Old Issue View Create sub-task button and popup screen:
 !image-2020-12-02-23-19-02-726.png|thumbnail! 

 !image-2020-12-02-23-18-16-103.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Create sub-tasks popup screen on New Issue View

fields.description:
(!) *Duplicated ticket from the Code Barrel instance*
Code Barrel ticket: *[https://codebarrel.atlassian.net/browse/AUT-2022]*

h3. Issue Summary

We currently can't use functions such as {{ number(myCustomVariable) }}, since the custom variable won't be coerced when used as a param.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

!image-2020-12-02-22-21-45-058.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to use Automation Variables inside functions.

h3. Actual Results
The Automation Variables aren't considered on functions. The Automation reads it as a string, like the *myCustomVariable* was the text, for example.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Custom smart value variable used as a param to another function doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Current scenario
[CSV importer|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/create-issues-using-the-csv-importer/] doesn't offer an option to chose whether email notifications are sent or not for the actions performed via CSV, while the [External System Import option with CSV|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/import-data-from-a-csv-file/] does offer this.

h3. Suggestion
Add the notification opt-in and out option to [CSV importer|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/create-issues-using-the-csv-importer/]
fields.summary: CSV importer should have an option to chose if email notifications are sent or not

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to change the permissions of the comment I'm about to post when using Jira Cloud for macOS app.

 !image-2020-12-02-22-53-48-641.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue view page does not update when you navigate between issues, like  linked issues, Parent-Subtask link, or Epic-Story link, or view another issue from description/comment of the current issue
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Open an issue and navigate to related issues like linked issues, Parent-Subtask link, or Epic-Story link
h3. Expected Results

We should see the full details of the issue we navigated to.
h3. Actual Results

While the URL shows the issue key of the navigated issue, the details page still shows the details of the previous issue.
h3. Workaround

Refreshing the page loads the actual content completely.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Converting an issue to a sub-task and selecting ‘Closed/Done' as the new status will skip the issue resolution screen and the resolution will not be set.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to the kanban board.
 # Convert an issue to "Subtask" from the board.
 !Screenshot 2021-01-07 at 2.45.32 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Select the new status as *_Closed_*.
# While moving the issue to a subtask in *Closed* status, the screen skips the *Resolution* field.
# Issues that are now moved as _sub-tasks_ to *Closed status*, does not have a Resolution.

h3. Expected Results
# While converting the issue type, users should get a screen to update the Resolution filed when moving the status of the issue to  *Closed*.

h3. Actual Results

* There is no option to update the Resolution field when an issue is converted to *Sub-task* and when updated the status as *closed*.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Resolution field is skipped when converting an issue to a sub-task and selecting ‘Closed’ as the new status.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

h3. Suggested Solution
Introduce the feature to log users who downloaded attachments on a site

Admins would like to know which users downloaded certain attachments

fields.description:
Greetings,

On Jira Software Cloud, when the user sets his language as Spanish in account preferences, all system fields gets translated but Jira Software specific fields (Epic Name, Epic Link, Sprint, Start date...) remains in English. The field descriptions are partially translated for some of them (it still reads epic instead of epica , for example), and not at all for others (start date).

 

!image-2020-12-02-09-33-49-395.png!

Also, as these fields are locked, their translation can't be customized per site, so it's nowadays impossible to show these fields in another language, or even change their field description.

These fields should be automatically translated as system fields are, or a way to translate them manually should be provided.

Kind regards,
fields.summary: Jira Software fields aren't / can't be translated
Set width in "print" view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
with the New Issue View enabled if there are any required fields configured for an issue type when attempting to use the quick create option under the issues in Epic panel in the View screen of an epic you will encounter the error "We couldn't create the child issue Check your connection, then give it another try"

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud with New issue view enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# enable the New issue View
# Set any field to required that is on the field scheme for a standard issue type on the desired project
#* where that required field is not in the Create screen of the issue type in question
# navigate to an Epic
# use the quick create "+" sign in the issues in Epic panel to create an issue 

h3. Expected Results
If there are required fields, a popup occurs allowing a user to enter the additional required field data points, 

h3. Actual Results
Only the Summary is allowed to be entered from this location and you encounter the error:
{quote}We couldn't create the child issue 

Check your connection, then give it another try{quote}
!Screen Shot 2020-11-30 at 4.16.02 PM.png|thumbnail!


h3. Workaround
The following Workaround is only available until Mar 31, 2021 noting:
{panel}
From Mar 31, 2021, we'll be moving all users on the old issue view in Jira Cloud products (Jira Software, Jira Service Management, Jira Core) to the new issue view — which means you won't be able to switch back to the old view anymore. For key dates, what's next, and more details, check out our [official announcement|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Transitioning-all-Jira-Cloud-users-to-the-new-issue-view/ba-p/1494104].
{panel}

Disable the New issue view by navigating to your user icon in the upper right of the screen, and selecting "Personal settings"  then scroll down to the "Atlassian Labs" section and deselect the green selector slider for the new issue view:
!Screen Shot 2020-11-25 at 3.14.42 PM.png|thumbnail!

With the new issue view disabled you will be able to use the quick create option from the issues in the epic panel
fields.summary: Cannot create child issue from Epic in new issue view when there is required field

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Changes made in *Settings > System > General configuration* are currently not tracked in the audit log.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add General configuration changes to the audit log.
h3. Why This Is Important

It's important for customers to track changes to the general configuration. For instance, they would like to know who and when someone unexpectedly turns on the public sharing feature _(Allow users to share dashboards and filters with the public_).
fields.summary: Log "General Configuration" changes in the audit log

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When accessing the "Send web request" action and selecting the "Webhook body" as "Custom data", the "Custom data" field remains greyed-out and cannot be edited

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Access the automation rules page in the project settings
# Click on *Create rule* (or edit an existing one that has the "Send web request" action)
# Add a trigger to the rule (you can choose any)
# Add an action *Send web request* to  the rule
# In the *Webhook body* field, select the option *Custom data*


h3. Expected Results

You can add custom data to the field and use it as the payload for the request

h3. Actual Results

The field is greyed-out

 !print.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

You can use the browser inspector do make the field editable, as described below:

# Right-click on the field and chose the option *Inspect*
# In the element as described below, remove the *disabled* clause and hit the "Enter" key on your keyboard.

{code}
<textarea rows="10" class="textarea long-field long-field" name="customBody" id="customBody" disabled=""></textarea>
{code}
fields.summary: The "Custom data" field in "Send web request" cannot be edited

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Ordering search result by entity property without passing `ASC/DESC` is impossible.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create add-on with searchable entity property ([https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-entity-properties/#making-searchable-entity-properties])
 # Create a query like 

{code:java}
order by issue.property[myEp].beataIsSuper{code}
(Where `myEp` is entity property name and `beataIsSuper` is one of extractions)

h3. Expected Results

Results are sorted (in some default order ie. DESC).
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
An unknown error occurred while trying to perform a search.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Pass `ASC/DESC` at the end of the query.
fields.summary: When I'm trying order search results by entity property without specifying order I'm getting an exception

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The date picker is showing the months and days in *English only*, regardless of the language the user chooses.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to your profile > Manage Account.
 # Click on Account Preferences.
 # Choose a language different from English.
 # Open an issue in Jira that has a Date Picker field.
 # Select a date.

h3. Expected Results

The date should be displayed in the language that the user chose.
h3. Actual Results

The dates are only displayed in English. See the image below:

!Date picker language.gif!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The date picker is only displayed in English, regardless of the language you choose

fields.description:
Currently, we do not have the ability to search for jira issues that were marked as incomplete when the sprint was completed.

Sprint report provides the ability to view the issues marked as incomplete in that sprint, however, with JQL we would be able to fetch incomplete issues from multiple sprints and also provide a time duration.
fields.summary: JQL functionality: Ability to search for issues via JQL that were marked as incomplete when the sprint was completed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
New issue view issue history is displaying custom date picker field with -1d

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field of date picker type
# Add it to the issue create/edit screen
# Update the field to set a date
# Check the issue history

h3. Expected Results
The issue history should display the same date as from the custom date picker field

h3. Actual Results
It displays the field with -1d from the original picker.
Switching to the old issue view will display the issue history correctly

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior while using the new issue view.
Switching to the old issue view will display the issue history correctly
fields.summary: New issue view issue history is displaying custom date picker field with -1d

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm facing a limitation with NextGen projects and custom fields created by custom addons.

Custom fields created with jiraIssueFields (atlassian-connect.json) are accessible from Next-Gen projects, but custom fields created dynamically in custom addon are not shown.

1 - I don’t see any rest end-point to create specific custom fields inside a NextGen Project

2 - Another option would have been to create a custom fields as “Connect Apps” by setting the same kind of field type : com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-connect-plugin:… and key *$(app-key)__$(field-key)* but this is not possible based on Rest documentation

This is a very annoying limitation for addons trying to offer the same level of features for NextGen users.

Best regards,
fields.summary: Ability to create custom fields dynamically in custom addon for NextGen projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Workflow with same steps name broke transition under this status, showing the message "*There are no incoming transitions to this status*".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *System* >> *Issues* >> open a *workflow*
 # Select a status without *Allow all statuses to transition to this one*.
 # Edit the *status name*, for example, *OPEN* to *OPEN2*.
 # Change the *step name* from *OPEN2* to *OPEN.*
 # Click on *Add status* and add a new *OPEN* status.
 # Add the transition from *OPEN* to *OPEN2*.

 * *[Video|https://share.getcloudapp.com/kpuNoXln]* showing this bug.

h3. Expected Results

When we try to add a *status* with a step name that already exists, the workflow should block to add this status, showing that already exist a step name with this status name.
h3. Actual Results

If we add a status with an existing steps name it will break all the status under this status, showing the message: "*There are no incoming transitions to this status*".
h3. Workaround

Rename the steps name to a different status name.
fields.summary: Workflow with same steps name broke transition under this status

fields.description:
*Summary*

Since the backup links are still valid for 7 days after its generation, it would be great that hyperlinks are shown in the backup section. 

Right now, they are gone when you start a new backup or after some hours. 

The current workaround is to open a support ticket with cloud support.
fields.summary: Previous Backup links should be available while they are valid

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The project key default pattern is the following:
{code:java}
[A-Z][A-Z0-9]+ {code}
If this pattern is not respected the following error will show up in the UI:
{code:java}
 We couldn't connect to that issue Make sure that this issue actually exists in that project. If it does, try again in a few minutes. If you still can't link to the issue, contact your Jira admin.  {code}
And the following error is thrown on the dev tool:
{code:java}
:authority: monsoonconsulting.atlassian.net
:method: GET
:path: /rest/api/2/attachment/read/issue/SUP-857/credentials?maxTokenLength=65536


{data: {issue: null, project: null},…}
data: {issue: null, project: null}
issue: null
project: null
errors: [{path: ["project"], errorMessages: ["No project could be found with key 'SUP'."],…}]
0: {path: ["project"], errorMessages: ["No project could be found with key 'SUP'."],…}
errorMessages: ["No project could be found with key 'SUP'."]
message: "No project could be found with key 'SUP'."
path: ["project"]
0: "project"
statusCode: 404{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try to restore a backup from a Jira server instance in which the project key pattern is not respected.
 # Try to access the Jira issue in the new issue view

h3. Expected Results
 * See the content of the Jira issue.

h3. Actual Results

!image-2020-11-26-12-35-57-324.png|width=522,height=151!
h3. Workaround
 * Disable the new issue view in Personal Settings.
 * Add the following to the URL:
{code:java}
 <instance_name>.atlassian.net/browse/<Issue_key>?oldIssueView=true {code}

 * Rename the project key removing the unsupported character (this may cause some problems on customers side).

h3. Notes:

The New Issue View enforcing mechanism has led clients to start facing this error in all projects. As the new issue view will be the default one next year, it will cause some impact on customers and also for the ones migrating to Cloud.
fields.summary: The New Issue View cannot fetch data when the Default Project Key Pattern is not respected

fields.description:
If you have multiple issue type of sub-task issue types, then the below behavior is seen.

h3. Steps to reproduce
- Create multiple issue type of sub-tasks
- Make one of the fields as required/mandatory in the sub-task screen.
- Open an issue with a sub-task in it and click on *create subtask*
- Select and sub-task issue type from the drop-down and type the summary and hit enter.
- As there is a field which is required, it will pop-up the issue create screen
- Notice that the summary that you have types remains as it is but the *issue type is flipped to the previous sub-task*(that was present in the case) so users must make sure they select the correct issue type before creation as it's now a different issue type chosen.

Expected Result:
Just like the summary getting copied over, the issue-type chosen should also get copied while the pop-up opens for the required fields to be updated.

Video of issue replication(0:00:30secs):
https://www.screencast.com/t/Cd565yJ5
fields.summary: Selected subtask to be autopopulated on issue creation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using the "_Jira Issues Calendar_" gadget with a filter that contains the project category field returns version from all projects in the instance.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a project
 2. Create a project category: *Category1*
 3. In that project, create a *Version* and assign some issues to it
 4. Follow the same steps above for a different project which doesn't belong to the same category
 5. Create a filter query similar to:
{code:java}
category = "Category1"{code}
6. Save the filter
 7. Create a dashboard. Add the "Jira issues calendar" gadget using the saved filter above. 
 8. Set "Display project versions" to "Yes".
h3. Expected Results

The gadget should display versions only from projects belonging to the project category set in the filter.
h3. Actual Results

All project versions are displayed

h3. Workaround
Create a filter that includes the required projects instead of the project category and then use this filter to setup the Jira Calendar gadget:

{code}project in ("project 1","project 2",...){code}
fields.summary: Using the "Jira Issues Calendar" gadget with a filter that contains the project category field returns all the version from all projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Convert issues to subtask and assign parent task (in next-gen project) via advance search list view. Parent issue-key(linking) is not present in the new/old issue view of the subtask, but in the parent issue child issues are not displayed in the new issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Search for nextgen-project in advance search

Convert the issue to subtask from Advance search (list view)
 for example:
 GRV-304: Parent issue
 GRV-305 is subtask(converted from standard-issue type)

!image-2020-11-26-11-11-01-196.png|thumbnail!

 Parent issue(GRV-304) is not having subtask(s) link in new issue view
 !image-2020-11-26-11-11-31-929.png|thumbnail!

Parent issue(GRV-304) is having subtask(s) link in old issue view
 !image-2020-11-26-11-12-18-752.png|thumbnail!

Subtask issue(GRV-305) is not having parent issue-key in the breadcrumb 
 !image-2020-11-26-11-13-41-638.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

In the nextgen project converted subtask should have a parent issue key in the breadcrumb. 
 The hierarchy should be present.
h3. Actual Results

Parent-child hierarchy is missing in the subtask

!image-2020-11-26-11-28-26-418.png|width=413,height=124!

There is no workaround.

At the moment, to avoid the situation of missing parent-child linking after converting issues to a subtask, please try to convert the issues to subtask through the issue view ( move operation).

fields.description: Create the ability to use custom text formatting like the description field. Sometimes the acceptance criteria is complex and multi-faceted. A better user experience would be to make information placed in this section more legible and easy-to-follow with text formatting.
