fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Classic view allows for entering exact time and date info a custom "Date Time Picker" field, However, the New Issue view has removed the granular time entry option and replaced it with a 30-minute increment picker list option, and can cause up to 15-minute discrepancies in time values where more precision is required.

i.e. the desired time entry is any value from 1:01 to 1:29, you are limited to 1:00 or 1:30 as the only available options  

h3.New Issue view:
!Screen Shot 2020-11-25 at 2.54.53 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3.Classic issue view:
!Screen Shot 2020-11-25 at 2.56.07 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to manually enter the time as needed for the custom time field
 
h3. Workaround
The following Workaround is only available until Mar 31, 2021 noting:
{panel}
From Mar 31, 2021, we’ll be moving all users on the old issue view in Jira Cloud products (Jira Software, Jira Service Management, Jira Core) to the new issue view — which means you won’t be able to switch back to the old view anymore. For key dates, what’s next, and more details, check out our [official announcement|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Transitioning-all-Jira-Cloud-users-to-the-new-issue-view/ba-p/1494104].
{panel}

Disable the New issue view by navigating to your user icon in the upper right of the screen, and selecting "Personal settings"  then scroll down to the "Atlassian Labs" section and deselect the green selector slider for the new issue view:
!Screen Shot 2020-11-25 at 3.14.42 PM.png|thumbnail!

once disabled date and time fields can be modified as needed
fields.summary: Add granular time settings back to the Date Time Picker custom fields

fields.description: Create the ability to use custom text formatting like the description field. Sometimes the acceptance criteria is complex and multi-faceted. A better user experience would be to make information placed in this section more legible and easy-to-follow with text formatting.
fields.summary: Text Formatting for Acceptance Criteria Field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the new issue view, when attempting to enter a partial number decimal value such as ".5h" to represent a 30-minute increment  or ".1h" to represent 6 minutes into the time tracking field while logging work on an issue will fail unless a "0" zero is added in front of the decimal,  Noting the behavior is specific to Jira Cloud and works without issue in Jira Server causing a usability discrepancy and barrier of use when migrating Server to Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Using New issue view
 # Log work on an issue
 # add a decimal value such as ".1h" or ".5h" or ".25h"

h3. Expected Results
Time is logged on the issue per the decimal value input the same way it is done in Jira Server

h3. Actual Results
It fails with the note:
{quote}
You need to log time in the format *2w 4d 6h 45m*
{quote}
 !Screen Shot 2020-11-25 at 2.17.03 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.NOTE:
Works in classic issue view and Jira Server, the failure occurs in the New Issue view only

h3. Workaround
add a "0" zero in front of the decimal, i.e. "0.1h" or "0.5h" or "0.25h"
Noting that In both Jira Server and Cloud beyond 2 decimal places the increment must be an increment of 5 as covered in:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23559
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23559
fields.summary: Logging work requires a value before the decimal in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to scroll the Issues in *All issues* page in Safari 14.0.1 browser
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to any project and click on All issues from Safari browser
 # Select any issue from the issue list that has a multiple comments and we can see the Scroll bar missing on the right side

h3. Expected Results

Scroll bar should be visible in order to scroll and look through the issue.
h3. Actual Results

Scroll bar not visible and unable to get through all the comments of the issue.

Can see the attached screen recording.
h3. Workaround

Opening the same site in other browsers are working fine without any issues.

Can use Chrome or any other supported browser.
fields.summary: Unable to scroll the Issues in All issues page in Safari 14.0.1 browser

fields.description:
h3. Actual Results

When a _User Condition_ is added to an IF/ELSE block condition, this is shown in the left panel as "matches" even though the "is not" option as selected as condition inside the _User Condition_:

!image-2020-11-25-16-59-49-374.png|width=504,height=252!

The "matches" makes a reference to the who IF or ELSE block, but this might sound confusing.

When a _User Condition_ is added as a separate condition, that is, not inside of an IF/ELSE block condition, the "is not" is shown in the left panel.
h3. Expected Results

The specific condition should be mentioned on the left panel, just as this happens with _Issue Fields condition_:

!image-2020-11-25-17-06-13-811.png|width=850,height=553!
fields.summary: User condition should be specified on the left panel when added to a rule inside an IF/ELSE block condition
